title: Can we have a blatantly "ugly" male/female in the game?
body:
Honestly, I want Riot to create a character that's so grotesque, I have difficulty imagining r34 content for that character. Seriously, some of the character's write themselves in terms of r34, and it doesn't even pertain to their lore.

Sylar is buff and half naked. Half the job is already done for the artists.
Zoe is canonically thousands of years old. FBI bullet dodged, artists continue to draw.
Dr Mundo is a sadist, who spends his life torturing zaunites while eating toenails....yet he has an 8 pack...?
_New kayle quite literally strips down in game, making me unsure whether this is hentai haven or league of legends._

Give me something grotesque, something impossible to lewd. Like take reksai, for example. She has excellent lore, no sexuality, and if i look up r34, I have regret, not surprised pleasure ( and it should be noted any "good" r34 of her is humanoid).

Give me warts. Give me flabs. Give me rotted teeth. Give me mismatched arm lengths. Have one of their eyes drip out of their sockets. Give me mixmatched boobs. I really want to see a champion who's design is so grotesque, that I can't help but love.

....but then again, in the year 2019, I'm sure that creating such a character would trigger someone out there, and cause the community to cry.

Remember Trundle?

Constantly rotting and regenerating, he used his Curiously Strongâ„¢ troll regeneration to contain a plague for his tribe. I identified with his condition.

And then we got a "troll king. KING!" who is a blue, musclebound hunk from Freljord. Making champs suddenly be from Freljord was all the rage in those days.

https://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Trundle_0.jpg

And Urgot... oh, Urgot.

https://gamepedia.cursecdn.com/lolesports_gamepedia_en/d/d4/Urgot_Splash_0_Oldest.jpg

He had some muscle definition in his arms from carrying those weapons, but the rest of him was a blob, which made sense for someone who's basically sedentary all the time. Even his prosthetic legs were cracked and ugly.

And now look what we have.

https://uploads.disquscdn.com/images/aa2af2cd73442e7cb333fe9b759971134f23bb667fc56db4aa7803c5cf1699cc.jpg

A musclebound badass with body art and a sweet ride. He even got an upgrade for his prosthetic legs, which are now fancy and in good repair (plus shotgun knees).

The last holdout is Gragas, who isn't even actually ugly; he could just stand to lose a bunch of weight.

There is no room for "ugly" in League of Legends. It's just too bad for anyone who doesn't like being held to unrealistic standards.

Just because a champion isn't popular doesn't make them any less of an addition to the game as another champion. I can't recall the last time I saw an Aureleon Sol, but their mains are either really good or really bad, and they can impact the flow of early game by themselves. 

Similarly, mordekaiser mains are really quiet, and just seek improvement. They laugh at how bad their main is, and laugh at all the bugs. Regardless, their community is quite wholesome.

I get what you mean, I really do: I imagine a grotesque champion might make me sickened after a while, and it may be why such a champ doesn't exist. Then again, there are the SAW series which are full of inhumane torture games, yet they're quite infamous for that same reason: a niche that is fufilled. Someone out there might just truly love horrid beasts, and might take up the character, similar to how someone who might like boobs might be more attracted to MF or Evelynn. A smaller audience, yes, but still there.

Also, I posted this under memes and games because if I put it under serious discussion, someone might think I'm calling them ugly, they might get offended, and if it's official then suddenly the message is misconstrued. Putting the idea here at least puts the thought in the heads of others, and whether they want to take it serious or not is up to them.
